comment._content: Tokyo Bay at the end of WW2. This photo is all over the Internet. bejohngalt.com/wp-content/uploads/2011/09/1945.jpg

comment.author: 28288340@N03
comment._content: I agree.  Tokyo Harbor.  Looks like an Iowa Class Battleship in the foreground.  That might be a CVE on the horizon forward of the BB and aft of the Tin Can(s)

comment.author: 49487266@N07
comment._content:
Surrender of Japan, 2 September 1945

Navy carrier planes fly in formation over the U.S. and British fleets in Tokyo Bay during surrender ceremonies.
USS Missouri (BB-63), where the ceremonies took place, is at left. USS Detroit (CL-8) is in the right distance.
Aircraft include TBM, F6F, SB2C and F4U types.

Source:www.history.navy.mil/photos/events/wwii-pac/japansur/js-8i.htm

Thanks, ChrisK48 and wingsnstuff!
comment.authorname: San Diego Air & Space Museum Archives
